result.markdown:
## After-tax Cost of Debt ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(101) #| eval: true #| results: asis #| echo: false #| warning: false rd <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.07, sd = 0.005) tax <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.25, sd = 0.02) ``` ::: Aurora Technologies issues new bonds with a yield to maturity of **6.84**%. The corporate tax rate is **26.1**%. ::: {.question-block}
✅ After-tax cost of debt = rD × (1 – tax) = **5.05**%. Interest is tax-deductible, so the effective cost of debt is lower than the nominal rate.
:::
